title: 'Carpet Kings' plot to derail their old shops with nimbler rivals
text:
After their lucrative careers at DFS and Carpetright it seems Lords Kirkham and Harris are keen to remain hands-on

When Lord Harris of Peckham went round Carpetright’s shop in Guildford to tell staff it was closing down before the store managers had a chance to, it upset them. This was last year. He arguably had no right to be there.

Known as the Carpet King, Lord Harris founded the business in the late Eighties, but left in 2014.

Within weeks, the flooring tycoon went on to help his son Martin, who had also worked at Carpetright, to launch fledgling rival Tapi. The two businesses have been at loggerheads since.

More antics from the Harris clan and its top brass, as it persists in its quest...
